cross sentence ( single model setting ).from sentence:
Table 1 reports our results on the SNLI benchmark .
On the cross sentence ( single model setting ) , the performance of our proposed CAFE model is extremely competitive .

obtains.from sentence:
CAFE obtains
88.5 % accuracy on the SNLI test set , an extremely competitive score on the extremely popular benchmark .

88.3 % and 88.1 % test accuracy.from sentence: For example , CAFE also achieves 88.3 % and 88.1 % test accuracy with only 3.5 M and 1.5 M parameters

achieves.from sentence: Due to resource constraints , we did not train CAFE + ELMo ensembles but a single run ( and single model ) of CAFE + ELMo already achieves 89.0 score on SNLI .

has.from sentence: This outperforms the state - of - theart ESIM and DIIN models with only a fraction of the parameter cost .

lightweight adaptation.from sentence: Moreover , our lightweight adaptation achieves 87.7 % with only 750K parameters , which makes it extremely performant amongst models having the same amount of parameters such as the decomposable attention model ( 86.8 % ) .

5 CAFE models.from sentence: Finally , an ensemble of 5 CAFE models achieves 89.3 % test accuracy , the best test scores on the SNLI benchmark to date 3 .

significantly outperforms.from sentence: On MultiNLI , CAFE significantly outperforms ESIM , a strong state - of - the - art model on both settings .

outperform.from sentence: We also outperform the ESIM + Read model .

ensemble of CAFE models.from sentence: An ensemble of CAFE models achieve competitive re-sult on the MultiNLI dataset .

proposed CAFE model.from sentence: On SciTail , our proposed CAFE model achieves state - of - the - art performance .

performance gain.from sentence:
The performance gain over strong baselines such as DecompAtt and ESIM are ?
10 % ? 13 % in terms of accuracy .

outperforms.from sentence: CAFE also outperforms DGEM , which uses a graph - based attention for improved performance , by a significant margin of 5 % .
